
---
title: "Eisenhower's Matrix in R using Quarto"
---
``` {r setup} 
if (!require(ggplot2)) { install.packages("ggplot2") }
```

```{r} 
library(ggplot2)

df <- data.frame( Importance = rep(c("High", "Low"), each = 2), Urgency = rep(c("High", "Low"), times = 2), Category = c("Do", "Decide", "Delegate", "Delete"), text = c("Tasks you will do immediately.", "Tasks you will schedule to do later.", "Tasks you will delegate to someone else.", "Tasks you won't do.") )

task_list <- list(
  task1 = list(Task_Name = "Email Marketing Campaign", Importance = 5, Urgency = 4),
  task2 = list(Task_Name = "Website Update", Importance = 3, Urgency = 3),
  task3 = list(Task_Name = "New Product Launch", Importance = 4, Urgency = 5),
  task4 = list(Task_Name = "Team Meeting", Importance = 2, Urgency = 1),
  task5 = list(Task_Name = "Client Follow-up", Importance = 4, Urgency = 4)
)

tasks <- data.frame(
  Task = c("Task 1", "Task 2", "Task 3", "Task 4", "Task 5"),
  Importance = c(5, 4, 3, 2, 1),
  Urgency = c(5, 4, 3, 2, 1)
)

plot <- ggplot(tasks, aes(x = Urgency, y = Importance, label = Task)) +
  geom_point(aes(size = 3), color = "red") +
  geom_text(hjust = -0.2) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(1, 5, by = 1)) +
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = seq(1, 5, by = 1)) +
  labs(x = "Urgency", y = "Importance") +
  ggtitle("Eisenhower's Matrix") +
  theme_minimal()


plot <- ggplot(df, aes(x = Urgency, y = Importance, label = Category)) + geom_tile(aes(fill = Category), colour = "black") + geom_text(size = 6, fontface = "bold", colour = "white") + theme_minimal() + theme(legend.position = "none", axis.title.x = element_blank(),axis.title.y = element_blank()) + scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set1") + coord_fixed() + scale_x_discrete(limits = c("High", "Low")) + scale_y_discrete(limits = c("High", "Low")) + annotate("text", x = c("High", "Low", "High", "Low"), y = c("High", "High", "Low", "Low"), label = df$text, size = 3)

print(plot)
```
